intro: Echinospartum lusitanicum subsp. barnadesii, commonly known as the Barnade's thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in Mediterranean regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
